summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of a victim, referred to as [REDACTED], conducted on September 12, 2019. The document details her account of being recruited as a teenager for sexual encounters with Jeffrey Epstein, which lasted approximately three years. It describes the roles of Ghislaine Maxwell and other associates in facilitating the abuse, the financial transactions, and the victim's evolving understanding of the grooming process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexually abusing the victim, who was a teenager at the time. He paid her for sexual acts, gave her gifts, and helped with her college essays.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as being romantically involved with Epstein and present in his house. The victim perceived her as rude and complicit in coordinating the abuse.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: The interviewee, who was recruited at age 16 for sexual encounters with Jeffrey Epstein. She describes the abuse, financial payments, and the grooming process over approximately three years.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: A co-worker of the victim at Hollister who initially told her about the opportunity to meet Epstein for money. She later worked for Epstein, setting up encounters and managing aspects of the abuse.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned briefly as someone whose interests Epstein would discuss with the victim.

persons.name: Kevin Spacey
persons.context: Mentioned briefly as someone whose interests Epstein would discuss with the victim.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: Met the victim at dinner with Epstein, offered her a loan and a job as his assistant. The victim was suspicious and brought her boyfriend.

persons.name: Britney
persons.context: Another girl who called the victim, possibly on a three-way call, to ask if she had spoken to police, implying she would be 'taken care of' if she remained silent.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim.

persons.name: [REDACTED]
persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim.

persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim.

persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim.

persons.context: Present during the FBI interview of the victim.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused the victim, starting when she was 16, paying her for sexual acts and grooming her over approximately three years.
Described as having a complicated, on-and-off romantic relationship. Maxwell was present in Epstein's house and, according to the victim, coordinated the abuse.
[REDACTED] recruited the victim at Hollister, telling her about the opportunity to meet Epstein for money, and later facilitated encounters with Epstein.
[REDACTED] worked for Epstein, setting up appointments, being present during encounters, and managing aspects of his interactions with the victim and other girls.
Epstein and the victim had dinner with David Copperfield, who offered the victim a loan and a job.
Britney called the victim to inquire if she had spoken to police, suggesting Epstein would take care of her if she remained silent.

events.title: Initial Recruitment and Abuse
events.description: The victim, age 16, was recruited by a co-worker at Hollister and taken to Jeffrey Epstein's house for the first sexual encounter, which involved payment and limited touching.

events.title: Three-Year Period of Abuse
events.description: The victim visited Epstein's house regularly for approximately three years, during which sexual encounters occurred, she was paid, given gifts (including a car), and helped with college essays.

events.title: Police Visit to Epstein's House
events.description: Police showed up at Epstein's house while the victim was there, responding to a 911 call. This event contributed to the victim ending her visits.

events.title: FBI Interview of Victim
events.description: The victim was interviewed by the FBI, with attorneys and law enforcement present, providing detailed information about her abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Intimidation Call from Britney
events.description: After the police visits, a girl named Britney called the victim to ask if she had spoken to police, implying she would be 'taken care of' by Epstein if she remained silent.

events.title: Dinner with David Copperfield
events.description: Epstein and the victim had dinner with magician David Copperfield, who offered the victim a loan and a job as his assistant.

locations: 455 Madison Avenue, New York, New York (interview location)
Jeffrey Epstein's house (primary location of abuse, specific address not given)
Maspeth (location where victim stayed with a friend in New York)
Worth Avenue (shopping location with Ghislaine Maxwell)
Paris, New York, Bahamas (locations [REDACTED] would call from)
keyFacts: The victim was 16 years old and a high school sophomore when first recruited by a co-worker at Hollister for sexual encounters with Jeffrey Epstein.
The abuse lasted approximately three years, during which Epstein paid her, gave her gifts including a car, and helped with her college applications, while [REDACTED] facilitated the encounters.
The victim describes Ghislaine Maxwell as being present in Epstein's house, aware of the abuse, and acting rudely towards her, indicating Maxwell's complicity.
Epstein took numerous nude photographs of the victim, which were later recovered by law enforcement and shown to her during the investigation.

After police began investigating, the victim received an intimidating call from another associate (Britney) implying she would be taken care of financially by Epstein if she did not speak to authorities.
